name: Lecce
fun_fact: Fun fact: Lecce is called the 'Florence of the South' for its stunning baroque architecture, but locals insist it's unique - the 'Barocco Leccese' style features intricate, lace-like carvings made possible by the soft local limestone (pietra leccese). The Basilica di Santa Croce has more ornate carvings than all the churches of Florence combined!

hero_dishes.name: Pasticciotto
hero_dishes.description: Puglia's iconic breakfast pastry - crumbly shortcrust filled with silky custard cream and often a sour cherry
hero_dishes.origin_story: Invented in 1745 by pastry chef Andrea Ascalone in Galatina, a small town near Lecce. This humble pastry has become the symbol of Salento's sweet tradition, enjoyed warm from the oven every morning by locals.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Bar Martinucci, Caff√® Alvino (timeless classic), Pasticceria L'Incontro, Pasticceria Natale. Always fresh from the oven, best eaten warm.

hero_dishes.name: Rustico Leccese
hero_dishes.description: Savory puff pastry packed with creamy b√©chamel, tangy tomato, and melting mozzarella - best when warm and melty
hero_dishes.origin_story: The local favorite street food, perfected in Lecce's bars and bakeries. It represents Puglia's mastery of simple ingredients transformed into addictive comfort food.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Caff√® Alvino (some of the best in town), L'angolino di via Matteotti (highly recommended), Bar Martinucci. Available at nearly every bar and pastry shop.

hero_dishes.name: Puccia Leccese
hero_dishes.description: Soft bread roll filled with various savory ingredients - a traditional street food of Salento
hero_dishes.origin_story: Part of Lecce's vibrant street food culture, puccia reflects the region's 'cucina povera' (food of the poor) - rural families using fresh produce and simple ingredients.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Pasticceria Natale, street vendors throughout Lecce's historic center

signature_drinks.name: Caff√® Leccese (Caff√® in Ghiaccio con Latte di Mandorla)
signature_drinks.description: Traditional iced espresso with almond syrup - beautifully layered, bitter coffee kick morphing into sweet almond smoothness
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Invented right in Lecce, now a symbol of the city. Locals sip this throughout the day from outdoor terraces overlooking baroque piazzas. Made with espresso coffee, ice, and almond milk - the three ingredients have become inseparable from Lecce's identity.

signature_drinks.name: Aperitivo at Sunset
signature_drinks.description: Pre-dinner ritual of cocktails and snacks enjoyed as the sun sets over baroque architecture
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: As a vibrant university city, Lecce's aperitivo culture is lively and social. Locals gather at outdoor cafes in Piazza Sant'Oronzo and along Via Matteotti, sipping refined cocktails while admiring the honey-colored stone buildings glowing in evening light.

food_culture_notes: Lecce is made for lingering over coffee or aperitivo - embodying la dolce vita
As a university city, Lecce has a vibrant, youthful energy while preserving ancient traditions
The tradition of 'cucina povera' (food of the poor) is celebrated at restaurants like Corte dei Pandolfi and La Cucina di Mamma Elvira
Baroque architecture creates a stunning backdrop for outdoor dining and people-watching
Honey-colored pietra leccese buildings glow against the blue sky, creating an almost magical atmosphere
The city transforms at sunset into a social hub - perfect for experiencing aperitivo culture
